TopicTitle: Yep so the updated Ion engines are fantastic

Articles.Content:
So after doing some math I discovered that an ion engine powered craft, if built light enough, could actually take off vertically from the surface of Duna!!! Curious, I decided to modify one of my heavy ion landers slightly to see if I could make a hopper for exploration and well here are the results

To my amazement I had enough fuel to get to orbit (with quite a bit to spare)!!! So then I decided that I should refine my design a bit (add a way to refuel and bring the number of solar panels to a minimum) and I got this.

After a bit of work I even managed to get a mini variant working!!!

The mun was not very compliant while I was testing a larger 2 manned variant...

So yea basically I felt I should share this concept with everyone and see what the comunitiy makes of this curious concept. I defiantly found these craft to be EXTREMELY entertaining to fly around Duna (It really takes awhile to get used to landing) and I think that they might make a very interesting replacement for science gathering rovers when Duna finally gets multiple Biomes. So what do you think of this? Are you super excited to try to make a vertical takeoff Duna Ion SSTO? Do you think that the fact that this is possible is a testament to the overpowered nature of ion engines in the game?

If you want something to play around with here is the latest version of one of the craft I have made, I have yet to fly it on Duna but it should still work (its only slightly different from one of my most successful versions). Also the craft is a sub-assembly so make sure you put it in the right folder!!!

Edit- I've just tested the craft and it is fantastic!!!
